text: Is there something like DimensionalData.jl but where I can name blocks in addition to rows and columns? BlockArrays.jl or LabelledArrays.jl would work well if I only needed blocks, and DimensionalData.jl DimArray would work well if I only needed row and column indexing.

elements.text: Is there something like DimensionalData.jl but where I can name blocks in addition to rows and columns? BlockArrays.jl or LabelledArrays.jl would work well if I only needed blocks, and DimensionalData.jl DimArray would work well if I only needed row and column indexing.

text: could you wrap a DimArray inside a LabelledArray? or vice-versa?

elements.text: could you wrap a DimArray inside a LabelledArray? or vice-versa?

text: Ahh, yes I should have realised DimArray accepts any AbstractArray, so I've gone with passing a BlockArray into the DimArray constructor. Thanks!

elements.text: Ahh, yes I should have realised DimArray accepts any AbstractArray, so I've gone with passing a BlockArray into the DimArray constructor. Thanks!
